CatDescriptText: Barbara Glenn, high school student, Fifth Ward was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would ask him why would he want to endanger his own people, and us, and other people of the world. I would ask him to put a stop to the testing of nuclear bombs because it is injurious to the unborn children of the world and will result in them being brought into this world in deformed shapes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Barbara Glenn wearing dark coat with fur collar and holding book with threadbare binding, standing in front of building with advertisement for dog food, Downtown
